metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval:ExistenceEnumeration simple type is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval:ExistenceEnumeration simple type.

criterion.comment: Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'all_exist' is supported where no object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'all_exist' is supported where every object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'any_exist' is supported where no object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'any_exist' is supported where every object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where no object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where one object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where every object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'none_exist' is supported where no object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'none_exist' is supported where every object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where no object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where one object defined by the description exists on the system.
Test that the ExistenceEnumeration value 'at_least_one_exists' is supported where every object defined by the description exists on the system.

variable_object.comment: This variable_object references the integer value '0'.
This variable_object references the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
This variable_object represents a object that does not exist on the system.
This variable_object represents a object that exists on the system.
This variable_object represents multiple objects that exist on a system.

constant_variable.comment: This constant_variable represents the integer value '0'.
This constant_variable represents the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
